snippet: A new study suggests that some people who have received an autism diagnosis are able to improve significantly and not qualify for the diagnosis later in life.
abstract: New study published online by Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry suggests that some children who have received an autism diagnosis are able to improve significantly and not qualify for the diagnosis later in life; debate over whether recovery is possible has simmered for decades.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that some people who have received an autism diagnosis are able to improve significantly and not qualify for the diagnosis later in life.

headline.seo: Some With Autism Diagnosis Can Recover, Study Finds
headline.main: Some With Autism Diagnosis Can Overcome Symptoms, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Some With Autism Diagnosis Can Overcome Symptoms, Study Finds

keywords.value: Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry
keywords.name: organizations
